name: Best of re:Invent
description:

The Amazon Web Services Team

name: Building Advertising Businesses on AWS
description:
Are you doing something interesting or useful with AWS? If so, please contact us if you would like to present. 

Agenda: 

17:30 - 18:00 Arrive / Cold Beer
18:00 - 18:30 Building Advertising businesses on AWS – Dmitri Tchikatilov, BDM for Advertising
18:30 - 19:00 Kinesis & EMR – Roy Ben-Alta – BDM for Kinesis
19:00 - 19:30 Spot & EC2 Container Service – Jafar Shameem – BDM for Spot Instances
19:30 - 20:00 Q &A

Advertising customers are rapidly embracing AWS to create scalable solutions with global presence. We will discuss several technical trends in advertising industry and focus on specific AWS offerings which facilitate building advertising solutions. Companies like AdRoll, MediaMath and a few others are actively collaborating with AWS to improve service offerings and share the lessons learned. We will cover building a latency sensitive ad processing infrastructure for real time bidding, scaling the data flow across multiple AWS Regions, improving the economics of the solution by using advanced services and latest open source frameworks. We will be able to go deeper in several AWS services frequently used in advertising technology (Kinesis, EMR) as well as capturing the economies of scale at a lowest price point with our SPOT EC2 instances.

name: AWS Technical Deep-Dive Day
description:
Please RSVP and register here:

http://goo.gl/DBm6An

This is a technical event [masked] Technical Session Level) relevant for Engineers, Developers, System Administrators and Solution Architects who want to deepen their understanding of the AWS Cloud.

Attend this free one day event in Tel Aviv, which will include technical sessions, practical demonstrations, and open discussion regarding the latest service and product updates.

During this event we will focus on the the following use cases:

Developing Web & Mobile Applications

• Leverage AWS Lambda to develop event driven backendless applications. 

• Manage mobile identities and access using Amazon Cognito

• Continuously capture and process large amount of data with Amazon Kinesis

Leveraging Next Generation IT

• Store and share large amount of data using Amazon S3 and Amazon Elastic File System

• Analyze your data and gain insight of your customers and business using Amazon Redshift

• Obtain predictions using Amazon Machine Learning 

• Optimize your costs with Spot Instances

Testing and Deploying your Application

• Easily deploy and scale your application with AWS Elastic Beanstalk

• Install, operate and scale your containerized application with Amazon EC2 Container Service 

• Automate your release process using CodeDeploy, CodeCommit and CodePipeline

In addition, take advantage of ‘Bring Your Own Project’ office hours to get free 1:1 deep technical guidance from our AWS experts who will be available during the day. 

Please bring your architectural diagrams for the team to review (15 minutes allocated per attendee). 

Please register here: 

http://goo.gl/DBm6A

For more information please contact us at [masked]
 
We look forward to seeing you there. 

Best regards, 
The Amazon Web Services Team

name: DevGeekWeek 2015
description:
John Bryce Training and Israel AWS User Group are pleased to invite you to the DevGeekWeek 2015 conference. 

As a member of Israel AWS User Group, you are entitled to a unique discount of 150 NIS. 

For further information: http://devgeekweek.jbh.co.il/

DevGeekWeek 2015 is a 5 days event designed for developers, test engineers, architects, operation managers, development group managers, and anyone involved in the development process. The conference is a unique opportunity for face-to-face communication with experts and top guru speakers who present the latest trends in software development technologies and related field. 

DevGeekWeek conference features 5 full-day seminars, bring you the latest innovations in software architecture, application development techniques, QA & testing 

DevGeekWeek 2015 features 6 learning tracks: 

• Architecture & Management

• Big Data and Cloud

• Web Technologies & Development

• Mobile & Mobi-Web

• Dev. Engineering

• QAGeekWeek

This year DevGeekWeek 2015 includes a NEW platform dedicated for startups and individuals in the beginning of their way – Experts Hub. 

This platform will provide opportunity for the DevGeekWeek 2015 participants to meet experts that can assist and consult regarding a company or any other project on its first steps. 

The conference takes place at Daniel Hotel, Herzliya, 21-25 June, 2015. 

As a member of Israel AWS User Group, you are entitled to a unique discount of 150 NIS. 

For further information: http://devgeekweek.jbh.co.il/

name: How to Use ELK to Monitor Large-Scale AWS Environments

venue.name: Perion
venue.address_1: 26 HaRokmim, Azrieli Center 1, Building A, 4th Floor

description:
Are you doing something interesting or useful with AWS?

If so, please contact us if you would like to present. 

Agenda:

17:30 - 18:00 Arrive / Cold beer 

18:00 - 18:45 How to Use ELK to Monitor Large-Scale AWS Environments by Logz.io co-founders CEO Tomer Levy and VP Product Asaf Yigal

ELK (Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana) is the leading open-source, log-analytics platform that is used by companies including Netflix, Verizon, and Bloomberg to prevent and troubleshoot problematic events in their systems.

In this session, we will show attendees how to use ELK in the highly-scalable, multi-zone, and multi-region environment of Amazon Web Services. In the first part, we will review Logz.io's architecture and AWS implementation as an example case that will show how we've implemented a cloud infrastructure that is multi-region, highly available, and secured -- with multiple availability zones for data ingestion. In the second part, we will show a live demonstration of how to get started with ELK by shipping, parsing, and searching log files -- and then visualizing the events to understand them.

18:45 - 19:30 ElasticSearch as an analytics engine by Izhar Ravid, Data architecture manager at Perion.

19:30 - 20:00 Open Discussion and Q&A

name: Containers on AWS – Best practice and Amazon Elastic Container Service
description:
Are you doing something interesting or useful with AWS?

If so, please contact us if you would like to present. This meetup we have open stage with 5 min format.

Agenda:

17:30 - 18:00 Arrive / Cold beer 

18:00 - 18:30 Open Stage - 5min , 5 slides. Please submit your presentation before.

18:30 - 19:15 Containers on AWS – Ready to run Docker containers... in production?  Coinbase has containerized their production infrastructure and employs a variety of technologies to keep their fleet reliable, available and secure.  Topics discussed include Elastic Container Service, CoreOS, Etcd and Fleet.

Rob is a director at Coinbase and building systems that connect you with (what may be) the future of finance. His team is responsible for the systems that collect, stream, power and analyze the data connecting consumers to bitcoin across the globe. Previously, he led Data Science from the IT CTO’s office at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory. In this capacity he helped to expand the agency’s access, opportunities and capabilities with their interplanetary information. This work included the systems powering martian telemetry + imagery analysis, developing data capabilities for the Astronaut Office and modernizing space mission infrastructure. He has also worked to extend earth’s interstellar bandwidth as a lead engineer on the International Space Station’s laser communication system, OPALS, where Rob led SpaceX Launch Systems and Space Station Systems Engineering. His work contributed to the first successful american optical communication link with the International Space Station. When his head is out of the clouds, Rob is a longtime entrepreneur, endurance runner and Y Combinator founder of Apigy inc.

19:15 - 19:30 Open Discussion and Q&A

Open Stage Format:

 • Up to 5 min, 5 slides

• What are your AWS stories?

• What problems have you solved? • Hiring?

Submit your presentations: [masked]

name: Workshop - Automating AWS work with Ruby API
description:
NOTE:
Please RSVP and register using the following form. We will select first 20 participants with the most relevant profile :

http://goo.gl/QWkIMS

Agenda: 

17:30 - 18:00 Gathering and Beer
18:00 - 20:00 Hands On work: 

https://github.com/gilzellner/AWS_RubyAPI_Workshop/blob/master/README.md

Instructor - Gil Zellner

This is a hand-on workshop which will teach you to use the AWS ruby API to automate certain AWS tasks.
You would need basic programming knowledge in a modern language such as Ruby, Python, Java, C#.
You will need a Linux or Mac laptop (what we intend to do doesn't play nice with Windows).
You will need root privileges on said laptop to install required packages.

This workshop is intended for AWS beginners, or at least those not already automating AWS workloads.
Prior knowledge of Ruby is useful but not mandatory.

What am I responsible for?
At least one week prior to the event we will release a list of things to install on your machine as not to make download speeds a bottleneck.
Please create an AWS account in advance.
Those of you who attend will receive credit to be used during the workshop.

What is the class size?
This class allows up to 20 participants.

Where is this training taking place?
The hands-on will be held at Herzliya.

name: Architecting for HIPAA Compliance on AWS
description:
Agenda Overview: 

18:00 – 18:15 Gathering 

18:15 – 18:45 Ran Rothschild, Senior Account Manager at CloudZone - Achieving HIPAA compliance on AWS:

Cloud based HIPAA compliance can be achieved by building and maintaining internal procedures and processes, designing IT environments in a correct and un-compromising manner, and keeping up to date regarding any regulation changes/updates. No one should think that achieving compliance is easy, however, it should not be regarded as boiling the ocean.In this lecture I will review the barriers companies are facing when seeking HIPAA compliance and suggest methods in which to overcome them.

18:45 – 19:30 Marius Aharonovich, Cloud Security Architect at ClickSoftware:

ClickSoftware Cloud Service is a SaaS deployed in AWS and is storing and processing personal information of the SaaS customers and also their end-customers. The Cloud Service is also HIPAA compliant and ISO 27001 certified, and implements security and privacy controls and practices which enable to deal also with ePHI. The cloud service uses AWS and third party solutions in order to cope with HIPAA challenges. The presentation will detail the path to achieve a HIPAA compliance SaaS. 

19:30 – 20:00 Moshe Ferber, Chairman of CSA Israel Chapter & Nir Valtman, Security Architect at NCR -Cloudefigo From zero to secure in one minute:

Cloud instances lifecycles are changing fast and forces us to improve the way we secure those IaaS instances. Nowadays we can find servers that are installed, launched, process data and terminate - all within a range of minutes. This new accelerated lifecycle makes traditional security processes such as periodic patches, vulnerability scanning, hardening, and forensics impossible. In this accelerated lifecycle, there are no maintenance windows for patches or ability to mitigate vulnerability, so the security infrastructure must adapt to new methods. In this new thinking, we require automation of instance security configuration, hardening, monitoring, and termination. Because there are no maintenance windows, Servers must be patched before they boot up, security configuration and hardening procedures should be integrated with server installation and vulnerability scanning and mitigation processes should be automatic. In this presentation, we announce a new open source tool called "Cloudefigo" and explain how it enables accelerated security lifecycle. We demonstrate how to launch a pre-configured, already patched instance into an encrypted storage environment automatically while evaluating their security and mitigating them automatically if a vulnerability is found. In the live demo, we leverage Amazon Web Services EC2 Cloud-Init scripts and object storage for provisioning automated security configuration, integrating encryption, including secure encryption key repositories for secure server's communication. The result of those techniques is cloud servers that are resilient, automatically configured, with reduced attack surface.

name: Big Data(EMR, DynamoDB)  - Deep Dive by AWS Product Managers
description:
Agenda: 

16:30 – 17:00 Gathering 

17:00 – 18:00 - Amazon Elastic MapReduce Deep Dive and Best Practices 

18:00 – 19:00 - Amazon DynamoDB: Data Modeling and Scaling Best Practices

19:00 - 19:20 - IronSource - how IronSource leverages Lambda to keep separate, cross-account environments synchronized in real time.

19:20 - 19:40 - SundaySky - using DynamoDB to drive a real time bidding (RTB) platform for personalized video ads. 

19:40 – 20:00 - Open Q&A (People can submit questions in the meetup including their expectations from the sessions).

Amazon Elastic MapReduce Deep Dive and Best Practices - Join this advanced technical session on Amazon Elastic MapReduce (EMR) for an introduction to Amazon EMR design patterns. Learn how to scale your cluster up or down dynamically and about ways you can fine-tune your cluster. We also share best practices to keep your Amazon EMR cluster cost efficient.

The session will be delivered by Rahul Pathak Principal product manager from AWS

Amazon DynamoDB: Data Modeling and Scaling Best Practices - Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed, highly scalable distributed database service. In this technical talk, we disscuss how to use DynamoDB to build high-scale applications like social gaming, chat, and voting. We show you how to use building blocks such as secondary indexes, conditional writes, consistent reads, and batch operations to build the higher-level functionality such as multi-item atomic writes and join queries. We also discuss best practices such as index projections, item sharding, and parallel scan for maximum scalability.

The session will be delivered by Khawaja Shams Sr Mngr, Software Development, DBS NoSQL and In-Memory at AWS


Joseph Mermelstein, Chief Software Architect at SundaySky, will talk about using DynamoDB to drive a real time bidding (RTB) platform for personalized video ads.


Roman Labunsky, Infrastructure Software Development Team Leader  at IronSource will described how IronSource leverages Lambda to keep separate, cross-account environments synchronized in real time.

name: AWS Technical Deep-Dive Day
description:
NOTE: DON'T FORGET TO REGISTER HERE:

http://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/aws-technical-deep-dive-day-israel-jan-7-2015-tickets-14842617669?aff=ILAWSUG

Attend this free one day event in Tel Aviv which includes technical sessions, practical demonstrations, hands-on information and open discussion regarding the latest service and product updates from the 2014 AWS re:Invent conference in Las Vegas.

In addition, take advantage of ‘Bring Your Own Project’ office hours to get free 1:1 deep technical guidance from our AWS experts who will be available during the day. Please bring your source code and diagrams for the team to review (15 minutes allocated per attendee).

This is a technical event relevant for Engineers, Developers, System Administrators and Solution Architects who want to deepen their understanding of the AWS Cloud. During this event, you will learn more about:

- AWS Lambda
- AWS CodeDeploy
- AWS OpsWorks
- Amazon Redshift
- AWS CloudFormation
- Amazon Cognito

Register now to:

•Join in live demos presented by Carlos Conde (AWS Cloud Evangelist for Europe, Middle East and Africa) to see how the newest products and services can affect you. •Get your questions answered in audience Q&A time after each demo. •Recieve free technical advice from our AWS experts during the 'Bring Your Own Project' office hours. Seating is limited so please register soon. Full agenda to follow shortly.

We hope to see you there soon.
